content:
That's great! It's always exciting to discover new resources and connections to the birding community.

"The Feathered Flock" podcast sounds like a great resource, and it's wonderful that they mentioned the nearby bird sanctuary in one of their episodes. It's always helpful to get recommendations from experienced birders and enthusiasts.

You might consider reaching out to the podcast hosts or producers to ask more questions about the sanctuary or get additional tips for your visit. They might have some insider knowledge or be able to provide more information about the sanctuary's history, habitat, or notable bird species.

Additionally, you could also try to connect with other listeners of "The Feathered Flock" podcast who might be interested in birding or have experience with the sanctuary. You could try posting on social media or joining a birding Facebook group to connect with other enthusiasts.

It's great that you're taking advantage of different resources to plan your trip and connect with other birders. I'm sure you'll have a fantastic time at the sanctuary and make some new connections along the way!

By the way, have you considered keeping a birding journal or checklist to track your sightings and notes during your visit? It can be a fun way to reflect on your experiences and track your progress as a birder.
